oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pre-Columbian Panamanian ceramic vessel with applique decoration
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pre-Columbian pottery with a narrow, rounded base. Rim is slightly constrictive and flaring, or everted. Around the neck is an appliqué ridge of alternating diagonal punctations. Below the rim, a pair of single appliqué lines branch into three, resembling a pair of bird feet.
Signs of carbon are visible around the base, neck, and opening of the vessel. Shows signs of general wear.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Antiquities, Prehistoric; Indians of Central America -- Antiquities; Indians of South America -- Antiquities
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: George and Louise Patten collection of Salem Hyde cultural artifacts
